Description: Body sherd of Chian pottery Type B kantharos; white slip; interior: glazed streaky brown; traces of two bands in added white; exterior, slip partly worn; part of narrow brown line; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number 2 is written on a paper label glued to the exterior surface of the sherd. Many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and as well as from Naukratis they have been found on Aegina (Williams 1983, 169). Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 169, no. 212)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 732, no. 932)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1685) (phase 2)
